verses.verse: Now the Philistines<WH6430> gathered together<WH6908> all their armies<WH4264> to Aphek<WH663>: and the Israelites<WH3478> pitched<WH2583> by a fountain<WH5869> which is in Jezreel<WH3157>.

And the lords<WH5633> of the Philistines<WH6430> passed on<WH5674> by hundreds<WH3967>, and by thousands<WH505>: but David<WH1732> and his men<WH582> passed on<WH5674> in the rereward<WH314> with Achish<WH397>.

Then said<WH559> the princes<WH8269> of the Philistines<WH6430>, What do these Hebrews<WH5680> here? And Achish<WH397> said<WH559> unto the princes<WH8269> of the Philistines<WH6430>, Is not this David<WH1732>, the servant<WH5650> of Saul<WH7586> the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478>, which hath been with me these days<WH3117>, or these years<WH8141>, and I have found<WH4672> no fault<WH3972> in him since<WH3117> he fell<WH5307> unto me unto this day<WH3117>?

And the princes<WH8269> of the Philistines<WH6430> were wroth<WH7107> with him; and the princes<WH8269> of the Philistines<WH6430> said<WH559> unto him, Make<WH7725> this fellow<WH376> return<WH7725>, that he may go again<WH7725> to his place<WH4725> which thou hast appointed<WH6485> him, and let him not go down<WH3381> with us to battle<WH4421>, lest in the battle<WH4421> he be an adversary<WH7854> to us: for wherewith should he reconcile<WH7521> himself unto his master<WH113>? should it not be with the heads<WH7218> of these men<WH582>?
Is not this David<WH1732>, of whom they sang<WH6030> one to another in dances<WH4246>, saying<WH559>, Saul<WH7586> slew<WH5221> his thousands<WH505>, and David<WH1732> his ten thousands<WH7233>?

¶ Then Achish<WH397> called<WH7121> David<WH1732>, and said<WH559> unto him, Surely, as the LORD<WH3068> liveth<WH2416>, thou hast been upright<WH3477>, and thy going out<WH3318> and thy coming in<WH935> with me in the host<WH4264> is good<WH2896> in my sight<WH5869>: for I have not found<WH4672> evil<WH7451> in thee since the day<WH3117> of thy coming<WH935> unto me unto this day<WH3117>: nevertheless the lords<WH5633> favour<WH2896> thee not<WH5869>.
Wherefore now return<WH7725>, and go<WH3212> in peace<WH7965>, that thou displease<WH6213><WH7451><WH5869> not the lords<WH5633> of the Philistines<WH6430>.

¶ And David<WH1732> said<WH559> unto Achish<WH397>, But what have I done<WH6213>? and what hast thou found<WH4672> in thy servant<WH5650> so long as<WH3117> I have been with thee<WH6440> unto this day<WH3117>, that I may not go<WH935> fight<WH3898> against the enemies<WH341> of my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428>?

And Achish<WH397> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> to David<WH1732>, I know<WH3045> that thou art good<WH2896> in my sight<WH5869>, as an angel<WH4397> of God<WH430>: notwithstanding the princes<WH8269> of the Philistines<WH6430> have said<WH559>, He shall not go up<WH5927> with us to the battle<WH4421>.

Wherefore now rise up early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242> with thy master's<WH113> servants<WH5650> that are come<WH935> with thee: and as soon as ye be up early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242>, and have light<WH215>, depart<WH3212>.

So David<WH1732> and his men<WH582> rose up early<WH7925> to depart<WH3212> in the morning<WH1242>, to return<WH7725> into the land<WH776> of the Philistines<WH6430>. And the Philistines<WH6430> went up<WH5927> to Jezreel<WH3157>.
